channel.title: Server keeps crashing :O
channel.description:
Well, I put my server on, then it just crashes and kicks everyone out. People cant log, it says "you are already logged in" so I always have to restart, but I cant stay at computer and wait for it to crash so I could restart it.
What could be the problem?

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @P_K P K
item.description:
@P_K wrote:

I did, but it seemed like they were talking to each other. And even if that was pointed out to me, I didn’t understand a thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

[quote=“P K, post:3, topic:166548”]THIS IS THE ERROR; help pls

[QUOTE]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NullPointerException
at client.sendFrame126(client.java:7202)
at client.update(client.java:12448)
at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:206)
at server.main(server.java:47)
[/QUOTE][br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 21, 2007, 06:30:45 PM[/size][/quote]

by that i can tell you that you are trying to send a packet 126 but it can’t form your packet since outSteam is null maybe your client is null by still trying to send sendFrame126 packet which can cause a nullexception since the outStream doesn’t exist it is null!

Read full topic

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:19, topic:166548”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=225777.msg1944907#msg1944907 date=1198310804]

What is assigned to outStream?

outStream is an instance of Stream. It is instantiated when the client logs in and creates a client instance.

Hmm. What’s line 206 of PlayerHandler?

For me it is the loop that iterates through every client instance and calls their clearUpdateFlags() methods. It is in the method that updates all the players every 500ms.
[/quote]
Ohk. I believe he is using an unassigned/uninitiated instance on like 206. If he could post that, I believe we could work it out.[/quote]

According to the stacktrace, the NullPointer was thrown inside the sendFrame126() method. That means that client Object was instantiated, which also rules out the possibility that outStream is not instantiated. The only other conclusion I can come to is that parameter s is null.

Read full topic

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:18, topic:166548”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=225777.msg1944898#msg1944898 date=1198310674]

What is assigned to outStream?

outStream is an instance of Stream. It is instantiated when the client logs in and creates a client instance.

Hmm. What’s line 206 of PlayerHandler?
[/quote]

For me it is the loop that iterates through every client instance and calls their clearUpdateFlags() methods. It is in the method that updates all the players every 500ms.[/quote]
Ohk. I believe he is using an unassigned/uninitiated instance on like 206. If he could post that, I believe we could work it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:17, topic:166548”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=225777.msg1944895#msg1944895 date=1198310596]

What is assigned to outStream?

outStream is an instance of Stream. It is instantiated when the client logs in and creates a client instance.
[/quote]
Hmm. What’s line 206 of PlayerHandler?[/quote]

For me it is the loop that iterates through every client instance and calls their clearUpdateFlags() methods. It is in the method that updates all the players every 500ms.

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

outStream is an instance of Stream. It is instantiated when the client logs in and creates a client instance.

P K, a null Object is an Object that has no (null) value. This means that you cannot try calling an instance field or method from an Object that is null, because it has no instance to call to.

Read full topic

item.title: Server keeps crashing :O
item.dc:creator: @P_K P K
item.description:
@P_K wrote:

line 7202 is

outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(126);

whole code is [QUOTE] }

public void sendFrame126(String s, int id) {
	outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(126);
	outStream.writeString(s);
	outStream.writeWordA(id);
	outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
	flushOutStream();
}[/QUOTE]

Read full topic
